Speaker: anchorman
Dialogue: Only after the numbers had reached into the thousands were officials able to identify the carrier of the deadly infection...

Speaker: director
Dialogue: Tell them we're ready for a live feed.

Speaker: reporter 1
Dialogue: ...an insect that has proven virtually immune to chemical control...

Speaker: reporter 2
Dialogue: ...the announcement by the Health Department that an end to the nightmare has finally...

Speaker: protester
Dialogue: ...Susan has always been opposed to biological tampering. A real advocate for ecological causes, it's not...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: ...in Nature, evolution is a long, leisurely conversation between an organism and its environment. We, however, did not have the luxury of time...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: With the aid of genetic labs throughout the country, we recombined cockroach DNA with genetic information from termites and mantids. We were able to create a biological counter-agent.  A new ally, if you will...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: The Judas is a non-carrier of Stricklers, with a short life-span and heightened pheromone emission.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: The female is basically a sexual magnet; common males travelled miles and fought for the right to mate with them.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: When they did, they took away something else we added -- a hormone, passed through sexual congress that causes their metabolism to go into overdrive.  No matter what their food intake, they starved to death in a matter of hours.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We've achieved almost total eradication of the roach population.  As of today, the disease has been officially contained.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Fucking thing! I hope someone's taping this.  Sus?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Life's a bitch. Our 15 minutes came and went and all we got was bad cable...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hiding from the hard glare of publicity?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: A shame.  You looked great tonight.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Do you think we did the right thing?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Taking a cab instead of hiring a limo?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: We did no impact evaluation.  The consequences of...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Is this a Catholic guilt thing...?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: There're gonna be a lot of kids running around next year because of you.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Who know?  We get lucky, maybe a couple of 'em'll be ours.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: We're down to a "couple" now, huh?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Oh, I don't know. People are beginning to talk about us...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Don't worry, I'll save your honor. Maybe I'll even marry you.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: ...no, guys, these have to fit perfectly.  No spaces in between. Let me tell you why. Insects have no hands. All they have is this set of mandibles.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: See?  This little piggy will grab the prey.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Then this little piggy will tear it in half...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: ...and this little one will grind it to a pulp and push it in... all the way into the mouth.  These are precision tools here. Can you remember that?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You know where they get this fertility stuff?  They extract it from the urine of menopausal Italian nuns.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Monks bottle their own wine. Don't they?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Trust me. I've never been this late. Never.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: If nun's pee is what it takes...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: You were the one who ran around with ice in his underwear, don't forget that.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Okay, meet me out front.  I gotta go. Josh's picking me up in five. see you tonight.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Siri, sandblast that thing. It looks like Trump Tower.  Those mounds are supposed to be made of dirt and excretions...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: ...So I say "buddy, you have every violation in the book.  Gimme one good reason not to close you down." You know what the Kraut says to me?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Selling your sould for a fistful of carbohydrates...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Not just any carbohydrates, mind you. It was like being on the receiving end of some kind of transcendent oral sex.  We should get a strobe on this thing. Maybe even a siren.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yeah, and a loudspeaker so you can yell "Epidemic! Epidemic! You're all going to die!"

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You really love flashing that thing, don't you?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Hey. I'm a short guy. Waddaya want?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Peter Tyler, DOH. You gentlemen were the first on the scene?

Speaker: woychek
Dialogue: We were both on patrol, saw this paint mess. Then I looked through that cellar window. We both did...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Get the EMT's in there, now.

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: C'mon Chuy, we're gonna be late.  Cops are bad news. Don't look at them.

Speaker: woychek
Dialogue: They look real sick, don't they?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: ...as long as they're ready for the opening I don't care, just tell them that.

Speaker: siri
Dialogue: I'm on it.  Don't worry.  Look, Susan...I don't mean to pry, but... I kinda overheard you and Peter.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Watch your step, Siri.  Your grant could be on the line here.

Speaker: siri
Dialogue: I just...well, I had this cousin in Delhi.  She was having problems, too. She, ah...

Speaker: siri
Dialogue: Not a big one.  I mean, it was like a turkey baster.

Speaker: siri
Dialogue: She kept it under her bed. Thing is, it kinda worked.  I mean, she had to hide it from her husband, but...

Speaker: siri
Dialogue: Oh, right... They been here since noon. I told them you're real busy.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Metaxonycha Godmani, Trigonopelastes Delta.  Field Butterflies.  Have you been upstate?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I guess they got lost in this city.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: There's extra wings in the bag.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: You guys have done a nice job.  How bout five dollars?

Speaker: ricky
Dialogue: Cost a dollar just to look.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: It's a great bug.  We kinda broke it a little...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Fellas, I'll tell you what...ten dollars for everything.  Plus a killing jar, some tweezers and mounts so the next bunch you catch will be in better shape.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Alphabet City kids- there's much worse things they could be selling.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: There's plenty of systemic infection already, so as soon as we get a preliminary reading, start them on anti-biotics. You saw this?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Internal hemorrage. 2 our of 5 have it.  No definite signs of TB, but we'll quarantine them a week just to make sure.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Immigration's gonna love you for that.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Tell them to send flowers to the usual address.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Two shifts, people rotating from bed to work.  One toilet. We're in Wal-Mart hell, here.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Did they get the sleazebag who owns this place?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Triad, Chinese Mafia. They bring people from Yunan. Slave labor...  Reverend Harry Wong, a preacher had the flophouse fronting for them. No sign of him.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Tell her she's going to be alright. We'll take care of her.

Speaker: yang
Dialogue: She's delirious.  Keeps saying the "Dark Angels" are coming for her. She says they took some of her people away.

Speaker: yang
Dialogue: Probably a gang.  Chinese people, man. They come up with some wacky stuff.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I'm gonna pull it out and I want you to pin it down, okay?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I have no idea.  Are you ready?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: And they're not fully developed.  This thing's not even an adult.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I know.  Help me get a sample.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Hold on, big guy, hold on...

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Not too little, not too much. You rub it in, around and around like this. Let the leather take it.

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: You watching? You should learn to work the shoes. You're good with your hands...

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Did you look at the story book I got you?

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Our Animal Friends.  Can you say that, Chico?  "Friends"?

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: In this city. A friend is a hard thing to find...

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: No one is there. Is empty.

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Chuy, listen to me.  They have Jesus on the cross, but that is not a holy place. You understand?

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Ah, Nino.  God only knows what goes on in your head, eh?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: There are thirty five listed in the reverend Wong's roster...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Remember what that woman said, about people being taken? Check with the copsin the area.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Thought it was my week for that.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I needed to think. It was either this or the weather channel.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: This thing was the size of my fist, Peter!! That's off the charts!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Okay. So you lost a great specimen-

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Don't you get it? It's more than that.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: You know why insects don't grow larger? Because they don't have a complex respiratory system. What I saw did. It had lungs.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Evolution doesn't work that fast. Something pushed that thing to take the leap. We need to find another specimen.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I did a PH test on its tarsal pads.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: There's only two species who match the enzymes I found.  One's a leaf-cutter ant in the Amazon...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: The other we released here two years ago.

Speaker: armenian driver
Dialogue: Avenue B... again! Maybe you got wrong letter, uh?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Keep going. We'll tell you when to stop...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Even if they did... that's all we have, isn't it?

Speaker: armenian
Dialogue: No... Oh, shit. Get away, you Turk!

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: You sure you didn't see one of these?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: An "Ootheca". An eggcase. It probably had more, uh "weirdbugs" inside.

Speaker: ricky
Dialogue: No way. I see one of those, I'd puke.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: It was in that corner over there.

Speaker: ricky
Dialogue: Sucker was fast, man.  Had to take it out with one a these.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Okay, guys.  We'll take it from here.

Speaker: ricky
Dialogue: Make it ten an' we won't tell the cops you're here.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Let's keep it at five and I won't condemn your clubhouse.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Let me try.  My hands are smaller.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Look, I showed you my badge...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Yeah, and you gonna have to show me a lot bigger one you wanna go down there. That's the old maintenance grid, Doc. Swiss cheese: tunnels, tracks...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: ...should know better'n to go sneakin' around my turf...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Fine.  You want me to call your supervisor?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Please do.  He's a lonely guy.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: That's wonderful!  What grade are you in?

Speaker: ernest
Dialogue: No school. Shoes're all Chuy knows about.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: He can imitate anything, you just watch him.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Excuse me, I'm talking to you.

Speaker: ernest
Dialogue: Is there some reward for this?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I guess that could be arranged.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: For Chrissakes.  You gonna lay a two- bit bureaucratic, territorial number on me?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: You wanna keep up the conversation, you best come back with the proper permits and the right attitude.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You give someone a fucking uniform and... Did you hear how he talked to us?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I heard how you talked to him.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Oh, so I'm the bad guy now?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: He was just doing his job.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Fine, then I'm the bad guy. Jesus!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: He wants a permit, I'll get him a permit.

Speaker: ernest
Dialogue: I told you to stick by the maintenance area.

Speaker: ernest
Dialogue: Graffiti artist, uh?  Look guys, just get off my beat, you hear?  Get moving.

Speaker: siri
Dialogue: It's just a headache.  We were sandblasting Trump Tower here since four this morning.

Speaker: siri
Dialogue: I'm fine. Go talk to Susan.  She could use a good word right now.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I get the feeling they came more for the potroast than the apterids.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Fuck 'em.  They don't know what they're missing.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Oh...nothing that a little menopausal's pee daikiri couldn't cure. Least that's what I thought.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Ironic, don't you think?  These guys can hatch hundreds of offspring in a single clutch of eggs, right? And here we are...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: ...I think it's some kind of systemic infection, Chris.  I saw a few cases like it yesterday. A sweatshop in Canal.

Speaker: raymond
Dialogue: Okay, look.  You better come in with me.  Help me through.

Speaker: raymond
Dialogue: All hands on deck, Pete. Remember the dril?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Looks like a Lyme disease rash.

Speaker: raymond
Dialogue: It's not consistent with the internal bleeding. Any idea what bit her?

Speaker: raymond
Dialogue: I think we're gonna need to have that specimen here.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: ...you don't even know what you're looking for.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You said that thing was big as your hand.  I don't think I'm going to miss...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Why take the chance?  Just let me go down there with you...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Susan, listen to me:  you handled that insect almost as much as Siri...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I know.  But if it was carrying something...there's a chance you could have been exposed.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Chris is going to run some blood tests on you.  I want you to stay here till he's absolutely sure you're clean.  Okay? Then you'll call me... You'll catch up with us...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We'll be all right, Sus.  I promise.

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: My father saw me stay in bed, he'd go get a pitcher. Cold water, whoosh, I tell you that's some alarm clock, brrrrr!

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Ah! There you go! The way you like 'em, Chu-chu...  We're low on milk, you remind Grampa to pick some up tonight, okay?

Speaker: workman
Dialogue: Hold up!  We gotta block on filter D.

Speaker: raymond
Dialogue: Your blood tests were all negative. You checked out.

Speaker: raymond
Dialogue: She's stable.  I don't think there's any immediate danger, but we'll have to keep her under observation...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: You think it's some form of Strickler's, don't you?

Speaker: raymond
Dialogue: Pathology's still working on the tissue samples.  If it is...it must be an errant strain.  Shorter incubation period.  I'm sorry, Sue.  We just don't know yet.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Take it out back and throw it in the friggin' dumpster!

Speaker: emt
Dialogue: Not unless somebody signs for it.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Okay, Jeremy...go get Dr. Chris Raymond, will you?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Did you hear me?  Get Dr. Raymond! NOW!!

Speaker: emt
Dialogue: Washed up at the filtration plant on Bank street. Some asshole there thought it was a baby. They called us.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Better hurry it up, Doc. My shift's almost over.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Guess someone requested you for overtime...buddy.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Posterior sternites are gone...half the protonum rotted off.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Near hatching.  Thing must've died about three weeks ago.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: You all watch your step.  We got some burrows goin' down seven stories here.  You fall, I don't wanna have to come pick you up.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: There's really people living down here?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Mole people. This section was pretty popular, all the way to Fulton Street...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Substance abusers, mental cases... Then about a year ago, Poof! All gone. Rumors got started... Someone found a couple of stiffs...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Down here's the land of talk, see? So the wildest version goes the farthest. They mark that area with a sign or a drawing, and its as good as closed.  We had one fella... for years said he was Bela Lugosi. Got him on Geraldo.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: It's me. Can you hear me?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yeah, barely. We haven't found anything down here. Nothing...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I'm on my way. I've got something for you to look at...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We'll be back at the platform in...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: 20 minutes. If you don't go sight-seeing anymore.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Funny.  Shoulda seen some track bunnies by now.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Track bunnies.  Rats.  They're usually around.

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: No, no, please understand... I can't wait that long.

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Please. I write it down.  2... 8... 7... 3. What does this mean "case number"? Okay. So, now what?  When can you...?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Fecal matter, unknown origin: weird shit.  Whatever it is, it's not human.

Speaker: repairman
Dialogue: Hey, Lady, all power will be down in five minutes, okay?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: I've never been this deep. This area here is the Old Armory station. They built it in the 40's. Ran out of money half-way through...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Okay, the fat lady's singing. Time to go.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Did you see the size of that thing?!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Look what you did! You stupid sonofa-

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Get the hell away from me!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You got a better way up?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Show that to the station manager.  Tell him Leonard's gonna have his bubble-butt he don't have someone down here in ten.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Way we came.  Take the first tunnel to your right...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I think so. One right, two lefts...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Oh shit, oh shit, oh shit!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Well...there's an old service elevator half a mile down the tracks.  Ain't gonna be much use, though.  Lines are dead.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You said those cables're still live. Can't we rewire...?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Oh, man, there you go again.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Those things bring juice to the new stations.  You just can't rewire that shit...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: For Chrissakes, what's the problem? You need a memo every time you fart?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: My God, what the hell are you...?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Listen to me:  we're getting you out.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: What are you doing down here?

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Chuy. He was taken. He's down here somewhere...  Oh, please, hurry. I saw what was after her.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: What the fuck is that?! What the fuck is that?!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Push it! Push it! Don't let up!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: You better tell me what the hell's going on here!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We don't know!! We don't know what it is!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Fuck you, wait a minute. I'm going to-

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: GET IT!  GET IT OFF ME!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus! It's hitting the bone man, get it off!!

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Is how we make loose the ticks back home.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Just keep holding it.  Can you do that for me?  Susan?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Yeah, I feel like ripping your fucking eyes out...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Leonard, listen.  I need to see if there's any nerve damage before we carry you back.  Look, I'm trying to help you here...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Oh, you helped me here, all right, white boy.  You and your goddam memo. You needed to prove your point, uh?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  But I don't think letting you bleed to death is the best apology.

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Where the hell'd that thing come from?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It doesn't matter, all right?  It's dead.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: How you know that?  Shit, it was runnin' around with its buttside gone and a fucking pipe through its heart...

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: But it look like a man. It... I saw it.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: That's what it wanted you to see.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: So, you're saying this is like those bugs that -- that look like twigs or leaves or...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: This is mimicry. They evolve to mimic their predators. A butterfly can look like the eyes of an owl.  A catterpillar can copy a snake...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: This has evolved to mimic the most dangerous predator it's ever had...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Mantids can mimic. We gave the Judas that code...

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: "...and behold he will come that walks as a man, yet is not a man- ..."

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: This, is our baby Peter. Yours and mine. Aren't you proud?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: All these...they're like tunnels of an insect colony. Once these things hit a certain population density, they'll have to move out, form new colonies.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: We have to get help down here.  Burn the tunnels before...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Third rail is dead.  Get me up.  There must be a manual override in the booth.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: His blood! It's driving them crazy! We have to mask the odor!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It's no use! They know we're in here!

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: They don't know anything Peter, they just sense. They're hardwired!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Right. Hardwired to eat anything that's not like them!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: What are you putting that crap on me for?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Scent glands.  Insects use 'em to identify themselves to each other.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: This track we're on? Goes down into the repair area.  The elevator's over here. Leads up to the active tunnels.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Can we get this car there?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Someone'd have to go to the switchroom, pull the coupling lever, that'll send us left and to the elevator.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Hell, I might be able to juice the whole area, if I can get to the power box. It's just a couple of cables...

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: Oh, how you gonna get there, Leonard? Hop?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Just talk me through it. I can go with Manny.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: It would take a minute or so.  You won't last that long out there.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Peter, you couldn't even fix our TV!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We'll cover ourselves with this. They can mimic us-  we Goddam mimic them!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: That's why we should do it now.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: It's just a regular old pump switch, okay? Right by the track signal board.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: The lights come up, you pull the switch.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: You don't do that, we're on the wrong track.  You...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: You gonna finally get to fuck around with the wires.  Think you can handle it?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: All right then.  You gonna find two wires.  One's green.  The other's blue...

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: He's out there. I heard him. How can he be? This things...

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: I didn't protect him, lady. He trusted me. And I didn't protect him... His father...I lost his father to the streets and now, Chuy...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: We'll find him. We'll be back and find him.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: You're going to have to keep it really slow.  Their eyes react to sudden movements.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Don't touch it.  And for Godsakes, try not to sweat.  They can sense chemical changes...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Whatever you do, don't step on the third rail coming back. Six hundred volts'll blow your leg right off.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I was just thinking how I could use a pair of pliers... and I remembered where they are...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: That's it. That's it. Breathe easy.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: In the tool box under the kitchen counter...

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: What's Manny doing? I can't see him anymore.

Speaker: manny
Dialogue: God has closed his eyes. This, he cannot see...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Over here! Over here! Goddam you!!

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: THE DOOR! OPEN THE FUCKING DOOR!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Manny never threw the coupling switch!! We're goin' the wrong way!!!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: No way we can outrun 'em together. Move it!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: NOW!! GO!! Get the hell off my beat!

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I can't tell if it's working!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You go first. I'll be right below you.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I can.  We can do this...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Don't hold your breath!  Keep it going, even flow!

Speaker: susuan
Dialogue: I'm really glad I'm not pregnant.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It'll be fine... it... They're still down there. We'll seal the whole system, go in with whatever it takes...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It'll be fine... We nailed them before, we'll do it again...

Speaker: train announcer
Dialogue: The 11:16 local to Poughkeepsie, boarding now, Track 32- the 7:20 Connecticut local, making connections to South Norwalk-
